intro_text: The cats head out into the crisp clear newleaf sun, and p_l leads them towards a massive messy eagle nest.
decline_text: When they get there, they discover that this nest isn't being used this newleaf. Disappointing.

success_outcomes.text: This close to the nest, the eagles take remarkably little notice of other animals. app1 can even see sparrows nipping in and out of their own nests, tiny things woven into the eagle one. It's an opportunity to observe a side of the birds birds that app1 never expected to see - to learn their body language and watch them with their chicks.

success_outcomes.text: p_l tells app1 to watch carefully as the parents arrive at and leave the nest - this is one of the only times a cat can study how an eagle flies without danger. success_outcomes.text: As they hide, watching the eagles feed their chicks, s_c tells app1 the story of an eagle chick that once fell from its nest and was abandoned by its parents. c_n took it in, and when it fledged over its first winter, it turned into a fierce she-cat whose claws could stand up to even the mightiest predator.

intro_text: Look at this. p_l gestures with {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} tail, calling app1's attention to the other side of the vast valley. In the snow, something is erupting out of a massive burrow.
decline_text: Best not to be anywhere near a bear fresh from hibernation, the cats decide.

success_outcomes.text: Have they ever starved? Felt hunger gnawing their belly, filled it with water just to get a moment's relief, felt their limbs tremble with weakness as their mind desperately yearns for prey? How long did that take, a day, a quarter of a moon? Imagine several moons in a row without food. Stay away from bears emerging from hibernation, p_l warns.

log.cats_from: from_cat listened to to_cat's warning about bears coming out of hibernation.
